title: Introduction to Variables and Data Types
description: This lesson covers the fundamental concepts of variables and data types in JavaScript.

content.content: In JavaScript, variables are used to store data values. Data types describe the kind of values that can be stored in these variables.

content.title: Declaring Variables
content.content: You can declare variables in JavaScript using `var`, `let`, or `const`.

content.title: Data Types
content.content: JavaScript has several primitive data types: Number, String, Boolean, Null, Undefined, Symbol, and BigInt.
This lesson provides a basic overview of variables and data types in JavaScript. In the following lessons, you will learn more about how to work with these concepts.
